conclusion: The problem involves determining how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves to the back right.
There are four objects casting shadows: a roll of paper towels with a red cross, a plate with red dots, a tall thin object, and a circular ring.
Shadow A is cast by the paper towels, Shadow B by the plate, Shadow C by the tall thin object, and Shadow D by the circular ring.

In the initial image, Shadow A is positioned to the right of the paper towels, Shadow B to the right of the plate, Shadow C to the right of the tall thin object, and Shadow D to the right of the circular ring.
The initial light source is assumed to be coming from the front left direction based on the shadows' positions.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadows will shift in the opposite direction compared to the initial position.
Shadow A, initially to the right of the paper towels, should move towards the back right relative to the paper towels.
Shadow B, initially to the right of the plate, should move towards the back right relative to the plate.
Shadow C, initially to the right of the tall thin object, should move towards the back right relative to the tall thin object.
Shadow D, initially to the right of the circular ring, should move towards the back right relative to the circular ring.
The size of a shadow depends on the distance between the light source and the object casting the shadow.
